result.execSummary:
The defendant Job Pacheco-Felipe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant to pay the County for attorney fees.

Work toward GED/HSED.
Obtain and maintain employment.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continued programming.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on 8/21/2015.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Job Pacheco-Felipe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets
12/2/15 bail refund notice mailed to surety.
Due to not following the AFTES payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended.
Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa

Defendant Job Pacheco-Felipe in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew

Defendant Job Pacheco-Felipe in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

As to Count 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction credit for 1 day time served with Huber privileges for work only.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/2015.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Work toward GED/HSED.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay the County for attorney fees.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness VANESSA H. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request X26207218 1X 4/20/15.
Letter in support of the defendant received and filed.

Defendant Job Pacheco-Felipe in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered chargee dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant Job Pacheco-Felipe in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial.  Defense counsel would like another date.  Court granted the request.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Job Pacheco-Felipe in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 02/18/2015 to repay Milwaukee County 50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 03/01/2015.
Sworn as interpreter:  Reme Bashi.

Defendant Job Pacheco-Felipe in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Heather Johnson as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Johnson accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 3/01/15 until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa

Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, and no possession of any dangerous weapons.
Court ordered the remaining balance of bail ($250.00) to be returned to the remitter.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VH/

Defendant Job Pacheco-Felipe in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/3/15 @ 1:30pm
